gonna start with a cupcake tray and

at all, at all... You also need a mixing bowl

Ro: While our cupcakes are baking, we're going to be making the green slime cupcake
Ro: filling! I'm so excited, this tastes really good. it tastes like fresh
Ro: lemons and it's like ectoplasm... Plasm. Jake: Plasm,
Jake: ectoplasm! Ro: Ectoplasm! So, the things you'll need will be green food coloring dye
Ro: You'll need 6 drops to get the right color. And, I would not suggest using the gel

Ro: food coloring for this, just the
regular liquid-based. Because it doesn't
Ro: dissolve the best with this recipe.
Ro: Also, you're going to need 2 eggs and...
Jake: 2/3 cups lemon juice and 3/4 cup white sugar.

Ro: Yum yum yum! And you'll need a
medium-size saucepan and a whisk.

Ro: Let's take all of this over to the stove
top and put it together!

Ro: The first thing your gonna do is turn
your stove on to low heat.

Ro: And, you're gonna pour the lemon juice
and the sugar into the saucepan and whisk

Ro: together until the sugar is completely
dissolved.

Ro: turn off the heat and slowly pour the
hot lemon syrup

Ro: into a little bowl with the two lightly
beaten eggs from earlier.
Ro: And remember to pour slowly, you don't want to cook your eggs and remember to
Ro: whisk constantly.  Then you're gonna return the mixture into the saucepan over medium heat.
Ro: Add six drops of green food coloring and stir constantly until the curd
Ro: starts to bubble and thicken.
Ro: Now, remove the pan from the heat and strain the lemon curd through a strainer into a small bowl.

Ro: Lastly, the slime we just made willhave
to chill

Ro: We're gonna put it in the fridge for 2
hours, you can cover it with some saran wrap.

Ro: Or, I've poured the slime into a little
squeeze bottle to make it easier to decorate.

Ro: A piece of wax paper and tape it right on top.  The first thing you're gonna do is take

like to do that outline a bit first.

need to do this because we've already
